data.title: Madonna
data.meta_description:
I do that too, as a nervous thing. Sometimes it's how people deliver bad news all you can do is laugh in exasperation. Still a dark moment...
Didn't Madonna...
data.text:
She's had a great week of press with the film retrospective and the documentary anniversary.

Memories of Madonna: Following the Material Girl Through the Years

by Michael Musto

http://www.villagevoice.com/music/m...g-the-material-girl-through-the-years-9014702

Ultimately, what's clear about Madonna's life on screen, through the ups and downs, is that New York was always her best co-star. And that makes sense. It's the city where she became Madonna.

http://gothamist.com/2016/08/23/madonna_nyc_movies.php

Reviewing the film in the May 14, 1991, issue of the Voice, J. Hoberman praised Truth or Dare as "a remarkable portrait of a sacred monster in her prime." The description remains unassailable — and is now all the more poignant, considering Madonna's diminished stature today.

http://www.villagevoice.com/film/ju...onna-doc-still-delights-and-confounds-9014703

Alex Keshishian: The movie showed a woman very much in control of her life and career. I mean, I have to say, she is still unbelievable in that regard. She is so astute. She is so smart. Working with her is a joy because you're dealing with someone who is really professional and cares.

http://www.papermag.com/madonna-documentary-truth-or-dare-1982808566.html

http://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/26/nyregion/new-york-today-madonna-in-new-york.html?_r=0

while she never threatened to become the next Meryl Streep, Madonna’s acting might not actually be that bad.

https://www.theguardian.com/film/2016/aug/21/madonna-acting-career-metrograph-new-york-retrospective
